abstract: A top official from one of the largest rating agencies told a House panel the American credit rating could be lowered.
snippet: A top official from one of the largest rating agencies told a House panel the American credit rating could be lowered.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The United States is unlikely to default on its debt obligations but its credit rating could still be lowered if it doesn’t come up with an adequate plan to address spending and its soaring budget deficit, an official from one of the country’s largest credit rating agencies told a House panel Wednesday.

headline.main: Credit Agency Tells Congress a Default Is Unlikely
headline.print_headline: U.S. Unlikely to Default, S.&P. Chief Tells Panel
